content.description: SDS on jugs, and climb straight up to the top. The holds on the arete are off.
content.protection: It is a short problem with a flat landing.
content.location: It ascends the SW corner of the Warm-Up Boulder.

content.description: Sit start at the left side of the west face on jugs. Make your way right along the lip to the right side of the face. It's fun and strenuous as the face is overhanging and the footholds are generally not good. The last 2/3 of the traverse involves slopers for handholds. The crux is probably around halfway or 2/3 of the way through the traverse.
content.protection: This a fairly low problem with a flat dirt landing except for a small root in one spot. You don't really even need a pad.

content.description: Start on crimps in the scoop and climb up and out of the scoop and up the slabby arete.
content.location: North side of the warm up boulder.

content.description:
Sit start with hands matched in the seam. From there, move up and right on the seam to the jugs, set the feet, dyno to the lip (or use a pair of sloping edges as intermediates), and mantle on top.

This is an eliminate, it does not use the arete. I'd imagine it goes about V2 if the arete is used.
content.protection: Perfect landing, pad, watch out for cars.
content.location: It climbs the far right side of the boulder's roadside/south face.

content.description:
Tough and slopy.  On the north side there is a tree.  It used to have a "don't camp here sign."  Next to the tree, traverse slopers from right to left across the lip and top out up the slabby arete above

Scoop

.  There is also a low/sit start possible on crimps by the tree.
content.protection: A pad or two.  Watch the roots.
content.location: The north side (away from the road) of the warm up boulder by the tree.
